website_summaries.verdict: The 2018 Razer Blade redefines the category it inspired: the super-slim, powerful gaming laptop. The best thin design in the business now packs a roomier 15.6-inch display and cutting-edge components.
pros: Slick, thin design, now with a larger (15.6-inch) screen
cons: A bit pricey for the parts
Design of speaker grilles mars sleek build

customer_reviews.title: Good looking laptop - too many issues to justify the cost
customer_reviews.text: The design of this laptop seems to be causing issues, trying to make it as small and thin as possible has introduced some problems which, to me, do not justify the very high cost. Light bleed on the LCD, heats up and fans start spinning at idle for no discernible reason, battery life nowhere near advertised, terrible sound (to the point where i'm wondering if the speakers on my unit are faulty) Buggy software (Razer synapse) keyboard commands such as screen brightness and key brightness intermittently stop working. Shame as the laptop looks very nice and feels premium (as it should) but is let down by all the above.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money.
customer_reviews.text: Screen bleed along bottom, slightly distorted image on lower left side where bezel was pressing against screen. Wonky S and D keys. Noisy buzzing power brick. Looks well made but the quality is Meh.
customer_reviews.author: George Newell

customer_reviews.title: Surpassed expectations - highly recommended!
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful, powerful, well balanced and a joy to use. Well worth its black Friday price. I did a Windows system backup via USB3 to an external SSD then replaced the internal 256 SSD with a 1TB version, installed Windows fresh and restored the system backup. Worked perfectly... Battery lasts ages when working in a coffee shop and gaming on power at home is a pleasure. Thermals are fine, display is great, keyboard and touchpad are great... How could it be improved? Illuminated shifted keys, Windows hello... and if they can keep this price range and battery life with a 4k 144HZ screen to go with the new 2080 MaxQ - Or maybe that would take a 3080 to drive?
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan

customer_reviews.title: The Razer of Razers
customer_reviews.text: Highly recommended Razer Blade. If you are not in the Apple universe then This is the Windows laptop you want. Beautiful. Screen is bezel to bezel and at 144 hz refresh Great for gaming and browsing. No negatives at all.
customer_reviews.author: Dean C. Weller

customer_reviews.title: Powerful slim gaming laptop
customer_reviews.text: I work away from home and needed a descent gaming laptop during the week. I finally settled for the Razer 15 and I am well pleased with my purchase. Good; Slim and excellent quality finish. Not too loud like most gaming laptops. Powerful graphics card handles all my AAA games at high resolution Bright vivid screen Per key RGB looks very nice and can be turned off for those who do not like RGB lighting Bad Not unique to this laptop but can get very hot with noisy fans when gaming for long duration Internal 512GB SSD may not be adequate for those with large Steam game libraries. (Although games can easily be run from external SSD)
customer_reviews.author: Tassader

customer_reviews.title: Battery Life
customer_reviews.text: The laptop is really nice to look at at first but is a finger print magnet. Battery lasts about 2 hours if the keyboard is at 100% brightness so I'd recommend turning it down and using power saving mode. When its turned down to about 10-20% the battery life is increased to about 4-5 hours.
customer_reviews.author: IskrenK

customer_reviews.title: All good so far, loving the blade. Super sleak and compact.
customer_reviews.text: I've had limited use of the Blade as I also use a Macbook pro though when I do bootup the blade its a pleasure to work on. Super quick using to render in 3dsMax and other apps. Played through Observer and high settings and looks superb. I have the 1060max Q. HDD will need upgrading when I have the cash as 256gb is ok if storing files on an external but files up quickly.
customer_reviews.author: marts_eastern_otaku_store

customer_reviews.title: Epic laptop
customer_reviews.text: Poor battery life but what a sexy laptop and i love it for play BF4 Its a massive fingerprint magnet though and quite tough to get rid of those fingerprint marks It also heats up a lot, invest in a cooler pad Super high quality build though, would still prefer the backlight for secondary keys
customer_reviews.author: buyer

customer_reviews.title: The best in class for a thin and light gaming laptop.
customer_reviews.text: If your budget can stretch to buy a Razer Blade I highly recommend giving it a shot. If you’re someone like me that enjoys the quality and finish of a MacBook Pro for example, buy you’re a gamer and love your high refresh rate displays, this (or any other model in this range) is the one to buy.
customer_reviews.author: Danny Rea

customer_reviews.title: Watch out for loss of camera dn mic
customer_reviews.text: This is a great laptop that performs brilliantly. Yes battery life is poor, yes it gets very hot and yes the fans are loud but that is expected when pushing something so thin so hard. What is not expected is what I now know to be a common fault and that is a problem with the ribbon cable for the camera and mic breaking meaning no conferencing option which is a major problem for me. New models have flat not folded cables which is an obvious design flaw. If I could return it I would but only to buy a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Ralph

customer_reviews.title: Screen issues
customer_reviews.text: Yes, all models using this panel tech have some minor bleed or glow. But this is an almost £2,000 laptop - I had 2 of them before giving up, rthe second being the worst of the 2 - it really is a gamble as their QC is not consistent. Other than that (if we don;'t mention the jerky and freezing webcam or the mouse pad that went haywire for 2hrs) it's pretty great.
customer_reviews.author: The Cobra

customer_reviews.title: Powerful but exterior not great
customer_reviews.text: The laptop is thin and powerful with an amazing keyboard and trackpad and lovely screen but the casing is really succeptable to finger prints and after 2 days had a couple of dings in the edge showing silver even with very careful use.
customer_reviews.author: Dolby

customer_reviews.title: Perhaps unreliable batteries
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately I am writing this review after just over 2 years using this device have elapsed. The device functioned flawlessly while in warranty, but unfortunately at the end of it’s warranty it decided to stop working. The issue my particular device started suffering from is battery bulge, which Razer themselves say is a normal occurrence and not a defect.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Bargain from the Warehouse
customer_reviews.text: Laptop has some marks on it but works absolutely perfectly and as advertised. Extremely satisfied with it.
customer_reviews.author: Fil

customer_reviews.title: Temperature is an issue
customer_reviews.text: The machine is amazing! Sleek, powerful but heats up A LOT. I’m averaging 77 C without over clicking while elevated.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Laptop
customer_reviews.text: Great gaming laptop. Only matched in build quality by the MacBook Pro. Very quiet even when playing games. Upgradable RAM and SDD is a added bonus
customer_reviews.author: Dominic C.

customer_reviews.title: Great gaming experience
customer_reviews.text: I love this laptop. I have had it for a couple of months now and I have nothing to complain about except the need for an external hard drive because the SSD is just not enough. Other than that, great build, easy to dust off and clean, Loud when playing but logical when playing on max graphics.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Only good performance for a high price
customer_reviews.text: It is not really worth for the price. Laptop has an annoying noise in the speakers that seems to be an interference from processor or an internal chip. Support in UK is unuseful, you will have to call them in another country. Battery lasts only a while.
customer_reviews.author: José M.

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Laptop
customer_reviews.text: This laptop is all i needed. I'm a creator and i needed great power, but also amazing looks. Thermals are great, no matter how much i push it it never thermal throttles. Very pleased with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Too expensive for poor quality
customer_reviews.text: I got two of the Razer blade 15 and both had the same issue. Such a pity as I liked the looks and the specs of this laptop a lot.
customer_reviews.author: George Ps

customer_reviews.title: Great gaming laptop
customer_reviews.text: A great gaming laptop packed with features without the bloat. Performs very well, would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: TopMarks15

customer_reviews.title: Bad Charger
customer_reviews.text: Charger burned after 1month use. Havent seen this bad quality and cant buy new charger from shop.. Anybody can help?
customer_reviews.author: indrek pärn

customer_reviews.title: Not to my expectations
customer_reviews.text: Normal performance and gets very hot with high graphics processing. The power supply was defect after one year. It cost more than 150 euros for a new one and it is not on stock.
customer_reviews.author: Haitham Karim

customer_reviews.title: Would definitely recommend
customer_reviews.text: Bought for uni and some casual gaming, this is an exceptional piece of kit and definitely worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew McCreath

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic build quality, Great for DIY upgrades much easier than rivals MSI stealth
customer_reviews.text: This laptop is amazing especially because you can update components yourself. so for 105gbp i upgraded to intel 660p 1TB SSD and 32GB RAM. you can also repaste with thermal grizzly to lower temperatures. Follow youtube guides just buy a good torx 5 screwdriver. I damaged my case slightly using a cheap 5gbp screwdriver set but then I updated to 8GBP set which has black painted tip for better grip. Battery life is double my Lenovo gaming laptop y700. I am very happy and the tems are low and Geekbench multicore scoring above 20k.
customer_reviews.author: S. Alimmarvasti

customer_reviews.title: Great laptop, would recommend anyone who is looking for a good laptop
customer_reviews.text: The laptop is great. The design is great, 144hz is perfect. The keyboard feels nice to type with (im using it right now) the performance for gaming is great. can ran fortnite at ultra at a consistent 70+ fps. if you can afford it then i highly recommend this. it may be a bit pricey for some. Only problem is that it takes a lot of setting up for the chroma, screen, performance while unplugged (geforce experience limits fps to 30 fps while unplugged. restriction can be removed manually in the geforce experience program) Nice lightweight and is definetiley portable. 4/5 for having a lot of setting up to do but works like a charm after.
customer_reviews.author: thomas anus

customer_reviews.title: Great laptop
customer_reviews.text: This laptop is perfect for any needs. I've had mine 6 months now and it is perfect. It hasn't crashed once, even with games and software on at the same time. It's perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Blake

customer_reviews.title: GET IT NOW
customer_reviews.text: This is the best gaming laptop. It says 144 Hz but runs mich fwster get it please..
customer_reviews.author: Aadam Ahmed

customer_reviews.title: Gets better fps in pubg than my desktop.
customer_reviews.text: Might change rating to 5 if the battery life is great but im quite happy. It actually out performs my gaming rig in pubg but is loud and hot when gaming not that it really matter cus it quite when not. On minimum settings it was locked solid on my framecap of 120fps and never went below 110 in game even with the 1060 max-q. The keyboard its great but for a laptop its fine and the tackpad is great and almost too big.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer
